page.title: 13EDUCATION:CHICKERELL SCHOOL
page.content: THE{VICTORIAN (RED BRICK) BUILDING OF{CHICKERELL COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL}IS A DISTINGUISHABLE LAND MARK AT THE JUNCTION OF{EAST STREET}AND{PUTTON {LANE. SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN{1875}THE SCHOOL HAS GROWN STEADILY IN SIZE.IT HAS SEVEN CLASSROOMS, WITH APPROXOMATELY 180 - 190 PUPILS (5 TO 11 YEARS).THERE ARE{7 TEACHERS ONE {PART TIME, SECRETARY (PART TIME), ONE {ANCILLARY ASSISTANT (PART TIME), ONE {CARETAKER,ONE CLEANING ASSISTANT (PART {TIME)}AND THE{HEADMASTER. THE SCHOOL CONSISTS OF THE MAIN BUILDING WHICH HOUSES{TWO CLASSROOMS, A{HALL,SMALL LIBRARY, HEADMASTER'S {OFFICE, SECRETARY'S OFFICE, KITCHEN, {STAFF ROOM}AND STORE ROOMS.THERE ARE 5 MOBILE CLASSROOMS AND THE CANTEEN IN THE PLAY-GROUND.THERE ARE 4 COLOUR TEAMS{RED,YELLOW,GREEN AND BLUE.
